text: Christchurch Hospital is a hospital in Christchurch, Dorset, England. == History == The hospital started in a workhouse built in 1882 and in 1913 was used by the Red Cross during the First World War. The hospital joined the National Health Service in 1948. After the Royal Bournemouth Hospital opened in 1989, a part of the Christchurch Hospital was sold in 1995. It is now a rehabilitation centre. == Services == There are numerous services available including a hospital, dermatology and a Macmillan unit (palliative care). == References == == Further reading == * == Other websites == * Hospital website Category:Hospitals in the United Kingdom Category:Buildings and structures in England Category:Buildings and structures in Dorset Category:19th-century establishments in England Category:1880s establishments in England Category:1882 establishments in England Category:19th-century establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1880s establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1882 establishments in Europe
title: Christchurch Hospital, Dorset
